paths

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • paths.Path
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arc, Blender, Circle, Composite, CubicBezier, Ellipse, Flower, Gesture, InfinitySymbol, Line, Lissajous, Plot, Rect, Shape, Superellipse, Supershape

    public abstract class Path
extends java.lang.Object
implements processing.core.PConstants
    A continuous sequence of points in 2D space.

    Usage:
    To get a point on an Path p, use p.trace(u) or p.trace(pt, u) where u is a floating point value between 0 and 1 and pt is a Point (a coordinate in 2D space).

    p.trace(0) returns a Point at the beginning of the path. p.trace(0.5) returns a Point in the middle of the path. p.trace(1) returns the point at the end of the path. And so on.

    Alternatively, you can use p.trace(pt, u) which, instead of returning a Point, stores the result of the computation in the given pt. This method is more efficient because it doesn't require a new Point to be allocated.

    To display an Path p, use p.display(g) where g is a PGraphics object.
    Author:
    James Morrow [jamesmorrowdesign.com]

      • trace

        public abstract void trace(Point pt,
                           float u)
        Given a 1D coordinate, a float, maps the coordinate to a 2D coordinate and stores it in a given Point.

        Maps a given floating point number from 0 to 1 to a given Point along the perimeter of the Path.
        Parameters:
        pt - The Point in which the result is stored.
        u - A number from 0 to 1.

        A continuous function from real values (floats) to Points.

        Maps a given floating point number from 0 to 1 to a Point along the perimeter of the Path.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PGraphics g,
                 int granularity)
        Draws the path by approximating it with a given number of sample points, and then connecting those points with lines.

        This is a useful shortcut for classes that implement IPath to use. It allows an IPath to define its proper display method in terms of this function.
        Parameters:
        pa - The PApplet to which the path is drawn.
        granularity - The number of sample points.

        Parameters:
        dx - The number of pixels to shift the path right.
        dy - The number of pixels to shift the path down.
